Detailed Description

Updates AppWidget state, gets information about installed AppWidget providers and other AppWidget related state. 

 // On the host side, you can do following functions through AppWidgetManager.

 // Create AppWidgetManager.
 AppWidgetManaget* mpManager = new AppWidgetManager(this);
 // To get all install AppWidgetProviderInfo.
 Vector<AppWidgetProviderInfo*> instanllObject;
 instanllObject = mpManager->getInstalledProvidersN(AppWidgetProviderInfo::PROVIDER_TYPE_HOME);

 // Bind AppWidgetId to the corresponding AppWidgetProviderInfo.
 // Define your AppWidgetHost ID before create an AppWidgetHost instance.
 int32_t mHostID = 1111;
 //Create an AppWidgetHost instance on your AP.
 AppWidgetHost* mpHost = new AppWidgetHost(this, mHostID);
 //Get a AppWidgetId for an AppWidget that will be added.
 int32_t mAppWidgetId = mpHost->allocateAppWidgetId()
 //Bind AppWidgetId with corresponding AppWidgetProviderInfo.
 AppWidgetProviderInfo* info = instanllObject.itemAt(i);
 mpManager->bindAppWidgetId(mAppWidgetId, info->getProvider());

 // To get the corresponding AppWidgetProviderInfo.
 AppWidgetProviderInfo* info2 = mpManager->getAppWidgetInfoN(mAppWidgetId);
 // To get all AppWidget ids for corresponding AppWidgetProvider.
 Vector<int32_t> ids = mpManager->getAppWidgetIds(info2->getProvider());

 // Notifies the specified AppWidget to invalidate it's currently state.
 mpManager->notifyAppWidgetStateChanged(mAppWidgetId, AppWidgetManager::STATE_PAUSE);

 // On the AppWidgetProvider side, you can do following functions through AppWidgetManager.

 // Update AppWidget on the onUpdate or the other callback function.
 RemoteWidget* rw = new RemoteWidget(context->getPackageName(), MyAppWidgetProvider::R::layout::widget_layout);
 // Update the specified AppWidget id.
 appWidgetManager->updateAppWidget(appWidgetIds[i], rw);
 // Update all AppWidget ids.
 appWidgetManager->updateAppWidget(appWidgetIds, rw);

 // Notifies the specified collection widget to invalidate it's currently data.
 appWidgetManager->notifyAppWidgetDataChanged(appWidgetIds[i], MyAppWidgetProvider::R::id::listwidget);

Member Function Documentation

static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_APPWIDGET_CONFIGURE ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Sent when it is time to configure your AppWidget while it is being added to a host.

This action is not sent as a broadcast to the AppWidget provider, but as a startPage to the Page specified in the AppWidgetProviderInfo meta-data.

The Demand will contain the following extras:

EXTRA_APPWIDGET_ID The appWidgetId to configure.

If you return Page::RESULT_OK using Page::setResult, the AppWidget will be added, and you will receive an ACTION_APPWIDGET_UPDATE broadcast for this AppWidget. If you return Page::RESULT_CANCELED, the host will cancel the add and not display this AppWidget, and you will receive a ACTION_APPWIDGET_DELETED broadcast.

static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_APPWIDGET_DELETED ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Sent when an instance of an AppWidget is deleted from its host.

See also:
AppWidgetProvider::onDeleted
static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_APPWIDGET_DISABLED ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Sent when an instance of an AppWidget is removed from the last host.

See also:
AppWidgetProvider::onEnabled
static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_APPWIDGET_ENABLED ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Sent when an instance of an AppWidget is added to a host for the first time.

This broadcast is sent at boot time if there is a AppWidgetHost installed with an instance for this provider.

See also:
AppWidgetProvider::onEnabled
static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_APPWIDGET_PICK ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Send this from your AppWidgetHost Page when you want to pick an AppWidget to display.

The AppWidget picker Page will be launched.

You must supply the following extras:

EXTRA_APPWIDGET_ID A newly allocated appWidgetId, which will be bound to the AppWidget provider once the user has selected one.

The system will respond with an onPageResult call with the following extras in the Demand:

EXTRA_APPWIDGET_ID The appWidgetId that you supplied in the original Demand.

When you receive the result from the AppWidget pick Page, if the resultCode is Page::RESULT_OK, an AppWidget has been selected. You should then check the AppWidgetProviderInfo for the returned AppWidget, and if it has one, launch its configuration Page. If Page::RESULT_CANCELED is returned, you should delete the appWidgetId.

See also:
ACTION_APPWIDGET_CONFIGURE
static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_APPWIDGET_STATE_CHANGED ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Sent when an instance of an AppWidget changed to the other state.

See also:
AppWidgetProvider::onStateChanged
static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_APPWIDGET_UPDATE ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Sent when it is time to update your AppWidget.

This may be sent in response to a new instance for this AppWidget provider having been instantiated, the requested update interval having lapsed, or the system booting.

The Demand will contain the following extras:

EXTRA_APPWIDGET_IDS The appWidgetIds to update. This may be all of the AppWidgets created for this provider, or just a subset. The system tries to send updates for as few AppWidget instances as possible.
See also:
AppWidgetProvider::onUpdate
static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_INSTALLED_APPWIDGETINFO_ADDED ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Sent when a new AppWidgetProvider package has been added on the device.

The data contains the name of the package.

May include the following extras: EXTRA_CHANGED_PROVIDER_LIST containing the set of package name.

static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_INSTALLED_APPWIDGETINFO_CHANGED ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Sent when an AppWidgetProvider package has been changed on the device.

The data contains the name of the package.

May include the following extras: EXTRA_CHANGED_PROVIDER_LIST containing the set of package name.

static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::ACTION_INSTALLED_APPWIDGETINFO_REMOVED ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: Sent when an AppWidgetProvider package has been removed on the device.

The data contains the name of the package.

May include the following extras: EXTRA_CHANGED_PROVIDER_LIST containing the set of package name.

static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::EXTRA_CHANGED_PROVIDER_LIST ( ) [static]

This field is part of AppWidgetManager#ACTION_INSTALLED_APPWIDGETINFO_ADDED, AppWidgetManager#ACTION_INSTALLED_APPWIDGETINFO_CHANGED, AppWidgetManager#ACTION_INSTALLED_APPWIDGETINFO_REMOVED, and contains a string array of all of the package name that have changed.

static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::EXTRA_CUSTOM_EXTRAS ( ) [static]

An Demand extra to pass to the AppWidget picker containing a List of Persistence objects to mix in to the list of AppWidgets that are installed.

It will be added to the extras object on the Demand that is returned from the picker Page.

static const base::String gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::EXTRA_CUSTOM_INFO ( ) [static]

An Demand extra to pass to the AppWidget picker containing a List of AppWidgetProviderInfo objects to mix in to the list of AppWidgets that are installed.

(This is how the launcher shows the search widget).

gaia::core::AppWidgetProviderInfo* gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::getAppWidgetInfoN ( int32_t  appWidgetId)

Get the available info about the AppWidget.

Returns:
A AppWidgetProviderInfo. If the appWidgetId has not been bound to a provider yet, or you don't have access to that appWidgetId, null is returned.
Persistence* gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::getAppWidgetOptionsN ( int32_t  appWidgetId)

Get the extras associated with a given widget instance.

The extras can be used to embed additional information about this widget to be accessed by the associated widget's AppWidgetProvider.

Note:
The instance must release by developer if not needs.
See also:
#updateAppWidgetOptions(int, Persistence)
Parameters:
appWidgetIdThe AppWidget instances for which to set the RemoteWidgets.
Returns:
The options associated with the given widget instance.
base::Vector<core::AppWidgetProviderInfo*> gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::getInstalledProvidersN ( int32_t  category = 1)

Get all AppWidget providers that are currently installed.

category The AppWidgetProvider category: AppWidgetProviderInfo::PROVIDER_TYPE_HOME or AppWidgetProviderInfo::PROVIDER_TYPE_BANNER.

Returns:
A list of the AppWidget providers information.

You need the MODIFY_APPWIDGET_BIND_PERMISSIONS permission

Parameters:

Returns:

void gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::partiallyUpdateAppWidget ( const base::Array< int32_t > &  appWidgetIds,
gaia::ui::RemoteWidget *  widget 
)

Perform an incremental update or command on the widget(s) specified by appWidgetIds.

This update differs from updateAppWidget(int[], RemoteWidget) in that the RemoteWidget object which is passed is understood to be an incomplete representation of the widget, and hence is not cached by the AppWidgetService. Note that because these updates are not cached, any state that they modify that is not restored by restoreInstanceState will not persist in the case that the widgets are restored using the cached version in AppWidgetService.

Use with RemoteWidget#showNext(int), RemoteWidget#showPrevious(int), RemoteWidget#setScrollPosition(int, int) and similar commands.

It is okay to call this method both inside an ACTION_APPWIDGET_UPDATE broadcast, and outside of the handler. This method will only work when called from the uid that owns the AppWidget provider.

Parameters:
appWidgetIdsThe AppWidget instances for which to set the RemoteWidget.
widgetThe RemoteWidget object containing the incremental update / command.
void gaia::core::AppWidgetManager::partiallyUpdateAppWidget ( int32_t  appWidgetId,
gaia::ui::RemoteWidget *  widget 
)

Perform an incremental update or command on the widget specified by appWidgetId.

This update differs from updateAppWidget(int, RemoteWidget) in that the RemoteWidget object which is passed is understood to be an incomplete representation of the widget, and hence is not cached by the AppWidgetService. Note that because these updates are not cached, any state that they modify that is not restored by restoreInstanceState will not persist in the case that the widgets are restored using the cached version in AppWidgetService.

Use with RemoteWidget#showNext(int), RemoteWidget#showPrevious(int), RemoteWidget#setScrollPosition(int, int) and similar commands.

It is okay to call this method both inside an ACTION_APPWIDGET_UPDATE broadcast, and outside of the handler. This method will only work when called from the uid that owns the AppWidget provider.

Parameters:
appWidgetIdThe AppWidget instance for which to set the RemoteViews.
widgetThe RemoteWidget object containing the incremental update / command.
